Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/get_ld.c

1/* mpfr_get_ld, mpfr_get_ld_2exp -- convert a multiple precision floating-point
2 number to a machine long double
3
4Copyright 2002-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
5Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
6
7This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
8
9The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
10it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
11the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
12option) any later version.
13
14The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
15WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
16or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
17License for more details.
18
19You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
20along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
21http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2251 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
23
24#include <float.h> /* needed so that MPFR_LDBL_MANT_DIG is correctly defined */
25
26#include "mpfr-impl.h"
27
28#if defined(HAVE_LDOUBLE_IS_DOUBLE)
29
30/* special code when "long double" is the same format as "double" */
31long double
32mpfr_get_ld (mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
33{
34 return (long double) mpfr_get_d (x, rnd_mode);
35}
36
37#elif defined(HAVE_LDOUBLE_IEEE_EXT_LITTLE)
38
39/* Note: The code will return a result with a 64-bit precision, even
40 if the rounding precision is only 53 bits like on FreeBSD and
41 NetBSD 6- (or with GCC's -mpc64 option to simulate this on other
42 platforms). This is consistent with how strtold behaves in these
43 cases, for instance. */
44
45/* special code for IEEE 754 little-endian extended format */
46long double
47mpfr_get_ld (mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
48{
49 mpfr_long_double_t ld;
50 mpfr_t tmp;
51 int inex;
52 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
53
54 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
55
56 mpfr_init2 (tmp, MPFR_LDBL_MANT_DIG);
57 inex = mpfr_set (tmp, x, rnd_mode);
58
59 mpfr_set_emin (-16381-63); /* emin=-16444, see below */
60 mpfr_set_emax (16384);
61 mpfr_subnormalize (tmp, mpfr_check_range (tmp, inex, rnd_mode), rnd_mode);
62 mpfr_prec_round (tmp, 64, MPFR_RNDZ); /* exact */
63 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (tmp)))
64 ld.ld = (long double) mpfr_get_d (tmp, rnd_mode);
65 else
66 {
67 mp_limb_t *tmpmant;
68 mpfr_exp_t e, denorm;
69
70 tmpmant = MPFR_MANT (tmp);
71 e = MPFR_GET_EXP (tmp);
72 /* The smallest positive normal number is 2^(-16382), which is
73 0.5*2^(-16381) in MPFR, thus any exponent <= -16382 corresponds to a
74 subnormal number. The smallest positive subnormal number is 2^(-16445)
75 which is 0.5*2^(-16444) in MPFR thus 0 <= denorm <= 63. */
76 denorm = MPFR_UNLIKELY (e <= -16382) ? - e - 16382 + 1 : 0;
77 MPFR_ASSERTD (0 <= denorm && denorm < 64);
78#if GMP_NUMB_BITS >= 64
79 ld.s.manl = (tmpmant[0] >> denorm);
80 ld.s.manh = (tmpmant[0] >> denorm) >> 32;
81#elif GMP_NUMB_BITS == 32
82 if (MPFR_LIKELY (denorm == 0))
83 {
84 ld.s.manl = tmpmant[0];
85 ld.s.manh = tmpmant[1];
86 }
87 else if (denorm < 32)
88 {
89 ld.s.manl = (tmpmant[0] >> denorm) | (tmpmant[1] << (32 - denorm));
90 ld.s.manh = tmpmant[1] >> denorm;
91 }
92 else /* 32 <= denorm < 64 */
93 {
94 ld.s.manl = tmpmant[1] >> (denorm - 32);
95 ld.s.manh = 0;
96 }
97#else
98# error "GMP_NUMB_BITS must be 32 or >= 64"
99 /* Other values have never been supported anyway. */
100#endif
101 if (MPFR_LIKELY (denorm == 0))
102 {
103 ld.s.exph = (e + 0x3FFE) >> 8;
104 ld.s.expl = (e + 0x3FFE);
105 }
106 else
107 ld.s.exph = ld.s.expl = 0;
108 ld.s.sign = MPFR_IS_NEG (x);
109 }
110
111 mpfr_clear (tmp);
112 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
113 return ld.ld;
114}
115
116#else
117
118/* generic code */
119long double
120mpfr_get_ld (mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
121{
122 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x)))
123 return (long double) mpfr_get_d (x, rnd_mode);
124 else /* now x is a normal non-zero number */
125 {
126 long double r; /* result */
127 double s; /* part of result */
128 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
129
130 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
131
132#if defined(HAVE_LDOUBLE_MAYBE_DOUBLE_DOUBLE)
133 if (MPFR_LDBL_MANT_DIG == 106)
134 {
135 /* Assume double-double format (as found with the PowerPC ABI).
136 The generic code below isn't used because numbers with
137 precision > 106 would not be supported. */
138 s = mpfr_get_d (x, MPFR_RNDN); /* high part of x */
139 /* Let's first consider special cases separately. The test for
140 infinity is really needed to avoid a NaN result. The test
141 for NaN is mainly for optimization. The test for 0 is useful
142 to get the correct sign (assuming mpfr_get_d supports signed
143 zeros on the implementation). */
144 if (s == 0 || DOUBLE_ISNAN (s) || DOUBLE_ISINF (s))
145 r = (long double) s;
146 else
147 {
148 mpfr_t y, z;
149
150 mpfr_init2 (y, mpfr_get_prec (x));
151 mpfr_init2 (z, IEEE_DBL_MANT_DIG); /* keep the precision small */
152 mpfr_set_d (z, s, MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
153 mpfr_sub (y, x, z, MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
154 /* Add the second part of y (in the correct rounding mode). */
155 r = (long double) s + (long double) mpfr_get_d (y, rnd_mode);
156 mpfr_clear (z);
157 mpfr_clear (y);
158 }
159 }
160 else
161#endif
162 {
163 long double m;
164 mpfr_exp_t sh; /* exponent shift -> x/2^sh is in the double range */
165 mpfr_t y, z;
166 int sign;
167
168 /* First round x to the target long double precision, so that
169 all subsequent operations are exact (this avoids double rounding
170 problems). However if the format contains numbers that have more
171 precision, MPFR won't be able to generate such numbers. */
172 mpfr_init2 (y, MPFR_LDBL_MANT_DIG);
173 mpfr_init2 (z, MPFR_LDBL_MANT_DIG);
174 /* Note about the precision of z: even though IEEE_DBL_MANT_DIG is
175 sufficient, z has been set to the same precision as y so that
176 the mpfr_sub below calls mpfr_sub1sp, which is faster than the
177 generic subtraction, even in this particular case (from tests
178 done by Patrick Pelissier on a 64-bit Core2 Duo against r7285).
179 But here there is an important cancellation in the subtraction.
180 TODO: get more information about what has been tested. */
181
182 mpfr_set (y, x, rnd_mode);
183 sh = MPFR_GET_EXP (y);
184 sign = MPFR_SIGN (y);
185 MPFR_SET_EXP (y, 0);
186 MPFR_SET_POS (y);
187
188 r = 0.0;
189 do
190 {
191 s = mpfr_get_d (y, MPFR_RNDN); /* high part of y */
192 r += (long double) s;
193 mpfr_set_d (z, s, MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
194 mpfr_sub (y, y, z, MPFR_RNDN); /* exact */
195 }
196 while (!MPFR_IS_ZERO (y));
197
198 mpfr_clear (z);
199 mpfr_clear (y);
200
201 /* we now have to multiply back by 2^sh */
202 MPFR_ASSERTD (r > 0);
203 if (sh != 0)
204 {
205 /* An overflow may occur (example: 0.5*2^1024) */
206 while (r < 1.0)
207 {
208 r += r;
209 sh--;
210 }
211
212 if (sh > 0)
213 m = 2.0;
214 else
215 {
216 m = 0.5;
217 sh = -sh;
218 }
219
220 for (;;)
221 {
222 if (sh % 2)
223 r = r * m;
224 sh >>= 1;
225 if (sh == 0)
226 break;
227 m = m * m;
228 }
229 }
230 if (sign < 0)
231 r = -r;
232 }
233 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
234 return r;
235 }
236}
237
238#endif
239
240/* contributed by Damien Stehle */
241long double
242mpfr_get_ld_2exp (long *expptr, mpfr_srcptr src, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
243{
244 long double ret;
245 mpfr_exp_t exp;
246 mpfr_t tmp;
247
248 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (src)))
249 return (long double) mpfr_get_d_2exp (expptr, src, rnd_mode);
250
251 MPFR_ALIAS (tmp, src, MPFR_SIGN (src), 0);
252 ret = mpfr_get_ld (tmp, rnd_mode);
253
254 if (MPFR_IS_PURE_FP(src))
255 {
256 exp = MPFR_GET_EXP (src);
257
258 /* rounding can give 1.0, adjust back to 0.5 <= abs(ret) < 1.0 */
259 if (ret == 1.0)
260 {
261 ret = 0.5;
262 exp ++;
263 }
264 else if (ret == -1.0)
265 {
266 ret = -0.5;
267 exp ++;
268 }
269
270 MPFR_ASSERTN ((ret >= 0.5 && ret < 1.0)
271 || (ret <= -0.5 && ret > -1.0));
272 MPFR_ASSERTN (exp >= LONG_MIN && exp <= LONG_MAX);
273 }
274 else
275 exp = 0;
276
277 *expptr = exp;
278 return ret;
279}
